title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 September 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:19 <polx> has quit  
01:01 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:15 <@cjd> sorry payday if that is actually your real name ;)  
02:25 <@sdumitriu> cjd: It really amazes me that a business like payday loans has such a good market  
02:26 <@sdumitriu> Basic math and reasoning skills would tell anyone that that's not a good way of "getting" money  
02:27 <@cjd> maybe drugs? no idea why people do what they do...  
02:28 <@sdumitriu> I'd say it's the american culture of spending  
02:29 <@sdumitriu> The "Shoot first, ask questions later" motto was replaced by "Buy first, think later"  
02:29 <@cjd> Heh, not only American but certainly more pronounced here.  
02:30 <@cjd> The US is kind of an enigma, it seems to be the home of the most "enlightened" and the most confused.  
03:17 <sdumitriu> has quit

09:18 <vmassol> good morning  
09:26 <vmassol> guys, can we removed this branch on platform: " enabled-csrf-protection" ?  
09:30 <vmassol> mflorea: there's a remote branch named "remotes/origin/release-4.2-milestone-1". Should we remove it?  
09:30 <vmassol> (looks like a bug)  
09:31 <+mflorea> not a bug, it was made to allow dev to commits on master, while I fix the issue with the release of 4.2M1  
09:31 <+mflorea> but yes, we can remove it now  
09:31 <vmassol> hmm maybe my local git isn't up to date since I don't see it on github  
09:31 <+mflorea> git remove prune origin  
09:31 <+mflorea> remote  
09:33 <vmassol> git remote prune origin --dry-run  
09:33 <vmassol> indeed  
09:33 <vmassol> thanks  
09:33 <vmassol> mflorea: this one is still needed: "remotes/origin/feature-extensiondistribution"?  
09:34 <+mflorea> nop, let me remove it  
09:34 <vmassol> ok  
09:34 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rc261e5b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c261e5b2d80a34d2dcf6b321a12f40aae2ea3594 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/extension/extension.js : XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/r94tYw  
09:35 <vmassol> I've pinged eddy about a few branches he has created and that I tihnk should be removed + pinged Denis about the security branch  
09:35 <vmassol> branch cleaning :)  
09:35 <+mflorea> that's good  
09:36 <vmassol> I'm creating a newmodel branch  
09:37 <+mflorea> great  
09:55 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <coud> has joined #xwiki

10:40 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r7622553 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/76225537dfe799358b3bbc4d518831e3b915d05b / (2 files): XWIKI-8141: Introduce a logging administration UI - http://git.io/q1AvoA

11:08 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol feature-newmodel \* rf5f383c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f5f383cef12326ba982555137d9b3236652870cf / (30 files in 7 dirs): XWIKI-8177: Introduce new Model API and bridge to the current oldcore Model - http://git.io/RcBNZA

13:20 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r10ce2ba https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/10ce2baa0155f8744b2c49db0a1db5624122b1f0 / (13 files in 8 dirs): XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/tv7\_oQ  
13:21 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* rff29664 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/ff29664df1b757864dc3748413aa51089fd04126 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/UserDirectory.xml : XWIKI-8176 : Add an entry for the User Directory in the applications panel - http://git.io/w5bdpg  
13:21 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r58d0f11 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/58d0f112e5785e668ee79f545f99f62957711132 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/UserDirectory.xml : XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/qgMhaQ  
13:22 <vmassol> jvdrean: I thought you wanted to remove the name?  
13:22 <vmassol> you changed your mind?  
13:26 <+jvdrean> yes, I think we need the internationalizable pretty name, for configuration UIs and default ordering at the extension point level (alphabetically on those names)  
13:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r97b5eeb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/97b5eeb5d8dd0b2055246b64aaa22410f32c4dc8 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-8178: Upgrade to Xalan 2.7.1 - http://git.io/Ek4VdA  
13:35 <CIA-121> tmortagne feature-portlet-3.5.x \* re34411f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e34411f8a23d77d81bb1d57f995d180f51a379bb / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-8178: Upgrade to Xalan 2.7.1 - http://git.io/Kdl-Kg

14:38 <tmortagne1> has quit  
14:52 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* rf7ef0fb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/f7ef0fb3f3f5de9fa40060e06e602cfccf4a8e29 / (5 files in 5 dirs): XCOMMONS-257: Install plan should return error when trying to install an extension providing a feature which is already a core extension - http://git.io/JUdDcA  
15:07 <vmassol> guys we need to decide stuff for the release  
15:07 <vmassol> RC1 is planned for next Monday and we haven't released M3 yet….  
15:08 <vmassol> mflorea: btw I just talked to Enygma` who's willing to do the M3 release (and learn how to do it at the same time)  
15:08 <vmassol> (with our help)  
15:08 <vmassol> so what do we do for M3?  
15:08 <vmassol> what's left?  
15:08 <+mflorea> vmassol: have you looked at ci.xwiki.org?  
15:09 <+mflorea> I'm working with Alex to stabilize the build. We can't release before that  
15:10 <vmassol> mflorea: apart from this are you all done?  
15:10 <vmassol> jvdrean: same question  
15:10 <vmassol> it's sad too that "automatic page generation" isn't there for 4.2 too sdumitriu  
15:11 <vmassol> (but too late now I think)  
15:11 <vmassol> re M3 our options are:  
15:11 <vmassol> 1) skip RC1 and consider M3 as our RC with sburjan testing it and we fix important stuff for final  
15:12 <+mflorea> there are still issue with EM upgrade, but we hope to fix them next week  
15:12 <vmassol> 2) postpone final by 1 week (which is not good since those are dates people expecet)  
15:13 <vmassol> ATM I think we need 2)  
15:13 <vmassol> since otherwise I fear the EM stuff is not going to be working well enough  
15:13 <vmassol> (not polished/tested enough)  
15:14 <vmassol> wdyt guys?  
15:14 <vmassol> ofc it means we'll have less time for the other future releases too if we want to get closer to the 1 cycle for 1 year  
15:15 <vmassol> tmortagne, mflorea, jvdrean, others: wdyt?  
15:16 <+mflorea> thinking..  
15:17 <+mflorea> re 1, you mean release M3 and then final, or rename M3 to RC1 and then release final?  
15:18 <+mflorea> it's strange to have final without a RC  
15:18 <vmassol> rename doesn't change anything  
15:18 <vmassol> it's just a name  
15:18 <vmassol> we've had this before  
15:19 <vmassol> but here I think it's risky because we have important changes that arrived late  
15:19 <vmassol> (the EM upgrade)  
15:19 <vmassol> so I'd rather take less risk  
15:20 <vmassol> the other option is of course not to enable it but that's a pity since it was one of the highlight planned for 4.2  
15:21 <+mflorea> well, as it is right now, it's easier/quicker to import the xar than to use the distribution wizard..  
15:21 <vmassol> oops :)  
15:21 <vmassol> quicker but more risky (no merge)  
15:21 <vmassol> (and more complex since you need to exclude stuff)  
15:21 <+tmortagne> well easier if you know what you need to import  
15:21 <vmassol> still I agree it would be better to streamline it  
15:22 <+mflorea> one issue is that it takes very long to resolve all deps, while in the xar you have everything bundled  
15:22 <vmassol> yep we need that local install mode too I think  
15:22 <vmassol> (there are companies forbidding internet access for ex)  
15:22 <+tmortagne> would not change much, its the number of dependencies the issue here  
15:23 <+mflorea> enterprise-ui has ~20 deps  
15:23 <+mflorea> direct deps  
15:23 <vmassol> anyway the question is whether one more week would be enough to have an upgrade process that is usable and that you're happy with (for a first version)  
15:23 <+tmortagne> XE is tarted to have a pretty bug tree of XAR extension and it's not going to get lower  
15:24 <+tmortagne> s/tarted/starting/  
15:25 <vmassol> OT: guys, Denis would like to releae 4.1.4 ASAP, please reply to his vote mail  
15:26 <+mflorea> on my side I want to implement the live update of install plan log (right now you don't get any feedback except a loading animation) and for enteprise-ui the plan take >5min to compute.. Besides that there are small things to improve on the UI, but 1 week should be enough  
15:27 <vmassol> indeed > 5 mn is long  
15:27 <vmassol> I can't imagine we spend 5mm just creating a dependency plan  
15:27 <vmassol> that includes download time?  
15:28 <+mflorea> I don't think deps (e.g. xars) are downloaded, tmortagne?  
15:28 <vmassol> what's taking long?  
15:28 <vmassol> pom.xml might be downloaded  
15:28 <vmassol> no?  
15:29 <+mflorea> I think so, so the time nexus/e.x.o respond is crucial  
15:29 <+tmortagne> xar are not downloaded but downloading all the pom.xml is long  
15:41 <vmassol> so, what do we do?  
15:42 <+mflorea> +1 for (2), but I'm not sure tmortagne will have time to fix the server side issues  
15:43 <+mflorea> re EM upgrade  
15:46 <+tmortagne> mflorea: the improvements we discussed on server side about conflicts with default classes are a bit too dangerous that close to final release and I won't have much time with other work I have to do  
15:47 <+mflorea> ok, the fake conflicts are fine for 4.2, but we need to investigate the speed issue and the issue with invalid extensions  
15:54 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:54 <+Denis> What is the status with Jenkins ? All these agent disconnected, is this expected ?  
15:55 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <polx> has quit  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> Yes, we're changing the VMs  
15:55 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol feature-newmodel \* r4170f3d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4170f3d3b9f1434e9ef0ca1e6e693cc96afb8ce4 / (27 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-8177: Introduce new Model API and bridge to the current oldcore Model - http://git.io/16zJxg  
15:56 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol feature-newmodel \* r25859a3 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/25859a3aac71c0d75caa2a7e4967ba3bf95f6bb3 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-model/xwiki-platform-model-api/pom.xml : XWIKI-8177: Introduce new Model API and bridge to the current oldcore Model - http://git.io/yHC3Ow  
15:58 <+mflorea> Denis: I'm working with Alex (out sysadmin) on this. If the platform build on vmaven-agent3 succeedes Alex will replicate vmaven-agent3  
15:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <tmortagne1> has quit  
15:59 <+Denis> mflorea: I have juste disconnected agent-1 for the release, and I was wondering about the few agents remaining  
16:00 <+mflorea> ok  
16:17 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r190c523 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/190c5237c3525cdd266ba830b4ad02436e655e8d / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7927 : Create an entry point for all available applications inside the wiki - http://git.io/9FZ6yQ  
16:17 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* rb008a84 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/b008a84ee72fa2a91d2ffaeb7ecb359c956e17cf / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/UserDirectory.xml : XWIKI-7927 : Create an entry point for all available applications inside the wiki - http://git.io/htyCBg  
16:17 <vmassol> jvdrean: indeed better (this is what I did for e.x.o too) ;)  
16:17 <vmassol> allows to use images other than icons  
16:18 <vmassol> hmm  
16:18 <vmassol> actually it depends if you wish to force to use an icon  
16:18 <vmassol> (which may not be a bad thing in this context)  
16:20 <+jvdrean> vmassol: I think that it'd be a bit too restrictive to force the use of icons  
16:21 <vmassol> not sure  
16:21 <vmassol> but your choice  
16:23 <+tmortagne> guys I'm searching all jar extension directly used by XE pages (only the XE pages, not the one coming from platform XARs)  
16:23 <+tmortagne> olddcore already trigger most of them but there is probably others  
16:26 <+tmortagne> annotations service seems used a lot  
16:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: adding missing deps in our pom.xml?  
16:26 <vmassol> (for xars)  
16:27 <+tmortagne> in XE one for now, it's actually an excuse to have strict versions to know when the XE xar is outdated (when upgrading the WAR for example)  
16:29 <+tmortagne> wanted to add a dependency on the WAR at first but does not seems that nice after all  
16:35 <+tmortagne> not annotations actually  
16:35 <+tmortagne> was not looking at the right pages...  
16:42 <vmassol> guys, so should I send an email proposing to postpone 4.2 final by one week?  
16:42 <+mflorea> +1  
16:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: ?  
16:44 <vmassol> jvdrean: ?  
16:45 <+tmortagne> +1  
16:45 <+jvdrean> +1  
16:50 <@sdumitriu> +1  
16:54 <ericpar> has joined #xwiki  
16:54 <ericpar> hi all  
16:55 <ericpar> I'm having an error message once I log into my xwiki account and found nothing on Google about that.  
16:56 <ericpar> I have a "Failed to execute the [include] macro" showing up in red, right below the "Comments / Annotations / Attachments / History / Information" line.  
16:56 <vmassol> ericpar: click on it  
16:56 <vmassol> you should get more details (stack trace)  
16:57 <mflorea> has quit  
16:57 <ericpar> looking at the java stack trace, I see that "Current user (me) doesn't have the view rights on document [xwiki:Dashboard:WebHome]"  
16:57 <ericpar> But I'm an admin on the XWiki...  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> Can you check if you can indeed view that document?  
16:59 <@sdumitriu> Are you in a virtual wiki environment?  
17:01 <ericpar> has quit  
17:02 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* rcf21f74 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/cf21f740c543d0997f8f83b0650a3e4eae374d43 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/pom.xml : XE-1231: The XAR project should indicate all the required jar dependencies too even if runtime dependencies - http://git.io/SC0IzQ  
17:08 <perlygatekeeper2> anyone know how I can put in a single quote into a  code block without having xwiki consider it a start to a string?  or alteratively how to make a box block be styled like a code block?  
17:11 <ericpar> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <@sdumitriu> perlygatekeeper2: Can you paste the code? I'm not sure I understand what you mean  
17:13 <@sdumitriu> If it's a {{code}} macro, then you can specify the syntax of the code, {{code language="none"}} to disable syntax highlighting  
17:14 <vmassol> perlygatekeeper2: choose language="none" if you don't want syntax highlighting  
17:14 <perlygatekeeper2> thank you!  
17:15 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol feature-newmodel \* rdc9a37a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/dc9a37aff5e599ca21279d6214d17f098cea39f6 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-model/xwiki-platform-model-bridge/src/main/java/org/xwiki/model/internal/BridgedWiki.java : XWIKI-8177: Introduce new Model API and bridge to the current oldcore Model - http://git.io/wA0clg  
17:26 <ericpar> sorry... I lost my connexion  
17:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'd like to use DefaultStringEntityReferenceSerializer directly as a POJO (not as a component) in EntityReference.toStirng(), ok?  
17:26 <vmassol> (no api is changed so it's safe)  
17:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: DefaultStringEntityReferenceSerializer does not depend on another component ?  
17:27 <vmassol> it's just the output of toString that's changed but for the best I think  
17:27 <vmassol> no it doesn't  
17:27 <vmassol> luckily ;)  
17:27 <+tmortagne> yea  
17:27 <ericpar> so that's the exception I have on the top of my stack: org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: Current user [xwiki:XWiki.EricParent] doesn't have view rights on document [xwiki:Dashboard.WebHome]  
17:27 <vmassol> and if it did I would hae refactored in a pojo  
17:27 <vmassol> both classes are in the same module too so that's nice  
17:28 <+tmortagne> vmassol: might be  safer to create another POJO withh documentation indicating that it should work as POJO and use it in DefaultStringEntityReferenceSerializer and EntityReference so that EntityReference is not broken later  
17:28 <vmassol> sure  
17:28 <vmassol> it's just a bit more work  
17:28 <vmassol> and we can do that when we need it  
17:28 <vmassol> there's no risk of breaking it inadverently  
17:29 <vmassol> since it wouldn't pass the tests  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> ericpar: Can you check if you can indeed view that document?  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> Are you in a virtual wiki environment?  
17:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'll do it if I find the time, otherwise I'll leave it for later  
17:30 <+tmortagne> ok  
17:30 <ericpar> @sdumitriu: I'll check...  
17:31 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:35 <ericpar> @sdumitriu: I can't: Error  
17:35 <ericpar> You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action.  
17:35 <ericpar> How do I change that?  
17:36 <@sdumitriu> Make sure you do have admin rights  
17:36 <@sdumitriu> Can you open the administration?  
17:36 <ericpar> let me see  
17:37 <ericpar> Can't Can't see it so I guess not  
17:37 <@sdumitriu> So rights are wrong  
18:09 <ericpar> has quit  
18:32 <+Denis> I am currently updating translation for the 4.1.4 release, so new files have been added: Sandbox/WebHome.fr.xml and XWiki/XWikiSyntax.fr.xml  
18:32 <+Denis> is that expected ?  
18:33 <+Denis> (I have also a new language pt\_BR, but adding it seems more expected than french stuffs)  
18:34 <@sdumitriu> We usually don't update translations for point releases  
18:34 <vmassol> sdumitriu: it's a good thing to do actually I think  
18:34 <+Denis> why ?  
18:35 <@sdumitriu> At least not all of them, because some things might not work  
18:35 <vmassol> Denis: did you check on a tag, for example, 4.1.3 if the file was there?  
18:35 <@sdumitriu> Like, changing translations for master to have new parameters, which won't work in the older branch  
18:35 <vmassol> indeed, that's a gotcha  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> (actually a translation should never be changed, but I've seen it happen in the past)  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> Or new translations that don't make sense for the older branch  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> So you should always be careful when committing translations in the old branches  
18:36 <+Denis> do not seen anything worrying, except these translation for french that are new  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> If they look OK, then commit them  
18:37 <+Denis> http://pastebin.com/hareR7tr  
18:37 <+Denis> why are these new, in particular XWikiSyntax ?  
18:38 <@sdumitriu> Why not?  
18:38 <+Denis> this is why I am suspicious, the pt\_BR should be ok, since there is no change in other language of the same file, but the new files for french seems to me very surprising  
18:38 <@sdumitriu> They really didn't exist before  
18:40 <+Denis> and in the XWikiSyntax, the syntax 2.1 does not seems to be mentionned  
18:41 <+Denis> The release process says "Review the changes", but this is not really explanatory  
18:48 <+Denis> The German Sandbox.WebHome as been destroyed, is there a way to revert the change on l10n ?  
18:49 <@sdumitriu> It's a wiki document  
18:49 <@sdumitriu> Revert from history, or if it was deleted, restore from recycle bin  
18:50 <+Denis> where is the doc ?  
18:52 <+Denis> sdumitriu: I have absolutely no understanding on how l10n is fitted, and where the data came from ?  
18:54 <@sdumitriu> http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XEXWikiXWikiSyntax\_951530617\_content\_de  
18:56 <+Denis> no  
18:56 <+Denis> its Sandbox.WebHome  
18:56 <@sdumitriu> Right...  
18:56 <@sdumitriu> My bad  
18:56 <+Denis> how do get the URL ?  
18:57 <@sdumitriu> http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XESandboxWebHome\_951530617\_content\_de  
18:57 <@sdumitriu> Click on "XWiki Enterprise" in the "Available Applications" panel on the left  
18:57 <@sdumitriu> Click "View" on the rightmost column next to Sandbox.WebHome  
18:58 <@sdumitriu> Choose "de" in the Available Languages section  
18:58 <@sdumitriu> "View all"  
18:58 <@sdumitriu> Click on "Content" in the first column (it's in the middle of the page, scroll down)  
18:59 <@sdumitriu> I'm reverting the change  
18:59 <@sdumitriu> Fixed  
19:00 <@sdumitriu> Should I delete the spammer account? Probably yes, it's called Anony Mous  
19:00 <+Denis> yes, surely  
19:04 <+Denis> ok, that the link on "content" that I was not aware of, thanks for the explanation
